Clarke, Mrs. J.W.
2219 Athol St., Regina.

To Sask. - April, 1902.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

A work of imagination to the person
undertaking this research.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on Pioneer Life because
no individual who has lived in Saskatchewan will have experienced exactly
the same things. It is impossible for you to answer all questions. You may prove
yourself a pioneer if there is not sufficient space to answer blank spaces. Use ex-
act dates of pioneer life if possible; if not, describe particular events. If they help to answer
the question.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada be-
fore 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer
years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should
write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did
Western Canadian Pioneers Think?" will still be available. If you have not already
answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at
a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you will be
willing to answer.

| Questionnaire |
|---------------|
| All questionnaires |
| Pioneer social conditions |
| Pioneer social life, sport and recreation |
| Pioneer education, religion and churchwork |
| Pioneer farming experience |

Preservation of Questionnaire

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's
office as the University of Saskatchewan Archives Board's permanent record of our
history. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
Clarke, Mrs. J.W.
2219 Athol St., Regina.

To Sask. - April, 1902.

1. Your full name: Mr. & Mrs. J.W. Clarke
2. Your address: 2219 Athol St., Regina, Sask.
3. Date: March 24, 1952
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country) Ontario, Canada
5. What was your father's name and occupation? J. W. Clarke, farmer
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year) April 1902
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible. Year 1 in Ontario

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you say "I was a small child," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West?

To have more land for my family

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)

Through the press

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you are under 18 years of age or you may use "I was a small child")
9. What were your reasons for coming West?

Through the truth
12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   family

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   by train

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way,
    meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, sicknesses or other misfortunes,
    etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Eastern Canada?
    On a farm near Murray's Lake

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
    Near Gray Lake, homestead

17. Mention any other places where you lived in Eastern Canada.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Eastern Canada? How about you now?
    Always on farms
12. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

I thought it was all right.

13. Did you travel by train or by car? (Family, friends, or other means)

Family

14. What mode of transportation did you use?

To go by train

15. What incidents of the journey? What do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures etc., the journey, difficulties or other experiences)

On a farm near Morley Saskatchewan

16. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Canada?

Quar Bay Saskatchewan

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Canada

Edith and Regina

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

Always on farms
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

Once a month

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date.

Mr. Clarke in 1910

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation it as a place to settle?

Yes

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell whom they came and where they settled.

Gray Lake

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

Mosquito was my bed, taught me in story acts.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

I ride a bit, church visiting, oh to twenty or more miles, team and democrat or sligh
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

Once a month

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date.

Mr. Clark in 1910

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation it as a place to settle?

Yes

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, when and where did they settle?

1910

23. Is there any particular experience of yours that stands out in your memory which you would like to share?

My youngest son was very bad, taught not in church

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? By what means of travel?

I ride a bit, church, visiting, up to twenty miles, team and democrat or slough
25. When was the first car used in the community? About 1908

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What makes?

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your house? Norman, 12 miles

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)

In 1912, a town was established at Eaton three miles away

29. How often did you shop in the early days? Once or twice a week or ten days

30. Then (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

In 1902 we were buying by mail from mail order houses at prices about 3/4 but this gradually decreased as the government by, to very little now

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

To come to make a permanent home in the west

in the west
The original homestead dates only
from back in 1916, many years not famous,
and moved to other land.

Quite a few moved away to other districts, can't
think of any that moved back.

Paul Stephens was built here in 1911 or so.

meeting with Agnes

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old papers and documents, minutes of meetings, reminiscences, old newspapers, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe).

Would you or the person who owns them either:
(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?
(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

(Indicate your preference, if any) …………….

40. If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

When I first came thru this area my family lived at 12 X 14 ft. house in the same district as my farm. Modern homes come with oil furnaces, air conditioners, hot and cold running water and power lines.
